statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Brian Laing scored 19 points and
Seton Hall forced 31 turnovers with a pressing defense in a 91-52
win over Caldwell College on Saturday that gave Bobby Gonzalez a
successful debut as the Pirates' coach.
article.headline: Gonzalez opens tenure as Pirates coach with win
article.linkText: Gonzalez opens tenure as Pirates coach with win
article.story: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Brian Laing scored 19 points and Seton Hall forced 31 turnovers with a pressing defense in a 91-52 win over Caldwell College on Saturday that gave Bobby Gonzalez a successful debut as the Pirates' coach. While Jamar Nutter added 15 points, Paul Gause had 14 and highly touted freshman guard Eugene Harvey chipped in with 11 points and nine assists, it was the Pirates' relentless defense that was the difference against the Division II opponent . Seton Hall forced turnovers on the Cougars' first four possessions, and on 10 of their first 12 in taking a 15-2 lead that was never threatened. Manny Perez had 15 points for Caldwell, which never got closer than 11 points after the opening run by its Big East Conference opponent. The 39-point deficit at the end of the game was the largest. The fiery Gonzalez, who was hired in April to replace the fired Louis Orr, was on his best behavior throughout the game at the relatively empty Continental Airlines Arena. The former Manhattan coach spent most of the game either in a catcher's crouch in front of his bench or standing and yelling instructions to his players. Other than that, he watched a young team playing an up-tempo game on both ends of the court perform well from start to finish. The 31 turnovers were eight more than the Pirates (18-12) caused in any game last season when they went to the NCAA tournament and lost in the first round to Wichita State. Orr was fired because the school administration wasn't happy with either his recruiting or management of the basketball program. Gonzalez, who led Manhattan to two NCAA tournament appearances in seven years, is trying to use the same pressing defense and fast-break offense with Seton Hall. It was very effective for the opening game. Nutter sandwiched a 3-pointer and a jumper around a Gause steal and layup in a game-opening 7-0 run. The Pirates led by as many as 22 points in the first half, turning 17 turnovers into 23 points and a 38-19 lead. A nine-point run that featured two points and two assists by Harvey, Gonzalez' prize recruit, quickly pushed the lead to 47-19 early in the second half. Freshman Larry Davis added 11 points and Mani Messy had 10 for Seton Hall, which shot 53.1 percent (34-of-64) from the field.
